Uses of Interface
org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters.api.BaseConverter

Packages that use BaseConverter
org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters   
org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters.api   
 

Uses of BaseConverter in org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters
 

Classes in org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters that implement BaseConverter
 class ArrayConverter
          Handles conversions to arrays from various types (including other arrays), also handles the special case of a comma separated list of strings which it will attempt to convert into an array of strings or whatever was requested
 class BigDecimalConverter
          BigDecimal passthrough
 class BigIntegerConverter
          BigInteger passthrough
 class BooleanConverter
          Converts objects into booleans (by default this will return Boolean.FALSE)
Special handling:
Numerics greater than 0 are true, less than or equal are false
Case is ignored when converting values to true or false.
 class ByteConverter
          Byte passthrough
 class CalendarConverter
          Passthrough to DateConverter for Calendar
 class CharacterConverter
          Converts objects to a character (will mostly truncate the string value of the object)
 class ClassConverter
          Converts a string to a class (this is pretty much the only conversion supported)
 class CollectionConverter
          Converter for collections (primarily for converting to other types of collections), can also from a scalar to a collection by placing the scalar value into the collection
 class DateConverter
          Handles conversions from objects into Date, generally the best way to handle this is to simply do conversions based on longs
Allows control over the conversion formats which are used by settings the patterns or the formats

Based on code from commons bean utils but updated for generics and removed complexity and (mis)usage of Exception
 class DoubleConverter
          Double passthrough
 class EnumConverter
          Handles conversions to enums (this is fairly limited to simply converting strings to enums)
 class FileConverter
          Simple converter to make File from strings
 class FloatConverter
          Float passthrough
 class IntegerConverter
          Integer passthrough
 class LongConverter
          Long passthrough
 class MapConverter
          Map converter to handle converting things into maps, Can handle simple cases by stuffing them into the map with the key "data"
 class NumberConverter
          Handles all the number conversions in a single converter, the other number converters are simply going to call through to this one
Special handling for Boolean, Date, Calendar, and String java.math.BigDecimal java.math.BigInteger java.lang.Byte java.lang.Double java.lang.Float java.lang.Integer java.lang.Long java.lang.Number java.lang.Short
Based on code from commons bean utils but updated for generics and removed complexity and (mis)usage of Throwable
 class ScalarConverter
          This is a special variable converter designed to handle the special case of converting from a non-scalar (collection, array, list, etc.) to a scalar object
 class ShortConverter
          Short passthrough
 class SQLDateConverter
          Passthrough to DateConverter for Date
 class SQLTimeConverter
          Passthrough to DateConverter for Time
 class StringConverter
          Converter to handle anything to string (this handles it in the way you would think)
 class TimestampConverter
          Passthrough to DateConverter for Timestamp
 class URLConverter
          Converts strings into URLs
 

Uses of BaseConverter in org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters.api
 

Subinterfaces of BaseConverter in org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters.api
 interface Converter<T>
          General converter interface written to specifically be compatible with the commons beanutils one
Allows for conversion between types that is more complete than the current ones
To use this, implement the interface with the type that you care about and then register it with the ConversionUtils by calling ConversionUtils.addConverter(Class, Converter) or you can use the constructor (the method is recommended though)
 interface InterfaceConverter<T>
          Special converter which is used for converting to an interface when more control over the type of implementation to create under the interface is desired
 interface VariableConverter
          Allows a converter to check to see if it can handle converting something before any of the converters are actually called, these converters are called before any of the other converters if they happen to return true, note that the order of the variable converters will match the order they were registered
